title.narrative: GCR Overall support of needs refugees

description.narrative:
One team of three (3) outreach, semi-mobile units based in Ioannina city will provide legal information in the 5 camps of Western Greece, namely Doliana, Filipiada, Katsikas, Konitsa and Tsepelovo. The mobile units will conduct scheduled visits in the aforementioned camps at least once a week, where they will provide information sessions to beneficiaries in relation to their rights to relocation, family reunification, and asylum procedures according to current legal developments, as well as psycho-socialsupport. GCR follows a holistic approach methodology in the sense that all services are combined to provide an overall support of the needs of each beneficiary.
GCR personnel will cover information and orientation issues in the sites regarding different procedures by operating in three (3) outreach units that will be comprised of two legal experts, two social workers and two interpreters. The outreach units will also provide legal assessments to detect and refer the most vulnerable cases to the relevant services, and legal support to ensure access to the asylum system by legal counselling (referrals and follow- up of cases). Services will include legal counselling and support to the Asylum Services for those who are entitled to proceed, especially after the set-up of Asylum Services that will be established in Ioannina city, as indicated by government officials. The outreach teams will be supported by a focal- point lawyer based at GCR Thessaloniki Office that will provide follow up of the cases duringthe application procedures, as well as by a Team coordinator that will coordinate the operations and workplan of the teams.
In midterm a detailed assessment will be made in order to decide the allocation of resources in order to cover people#s needs.The assessment will take into consideration factors such as the capacity of camps, composition of population i.e newcoming or standing population, ethnic groups and different needs, vulnerable cases etc. An important factor will be the aforementioned establishment of Asylum Services in the region, which would directly affect the course and swiftness of the activities and procedures. The overall goal of the project is to enable refugees and asylum seekers, which remain at the five (5) accommodation siteslocated in Epirus, to exercise their legal and social rights and to ensure access to them. Within this framework, GCR proposes a project which will support persons in need of international protection to access the protective services they deserve, with a focus on the identification and support of those most vulnerable amongst them. The activities outlined in the proposal will commence immediately, due to the emergency situation that the project addresses.

participating-org.narrative: Founded in 1989, the Greek Council for Refugees provides legal assistance and social support to asylum seekers and refugees; facilitates their social integration and promotes their legal and social rights. GCR#s work includes: social counseling, support for accommodation, education, work and other integration issues; free legal counseling and representation before the asylum authorities, the Hellenic Police, national courts and other judicial and administrative authorities as per need; border monitoring;educational and cultural activities for asylum seekers and refugees, including children; advocacy and promotion of refugee rights (participation in national and international networks, campaigns and several other fora; implementation of seminars for thepolice, local administrations, lawyers, prosecutors and judges; raising awareness in Greek schools); reporting to international and national relevant institutions and bodies on the asylum situation in Greece. GCR is governed by an elected Board of Directors and employs more than 100 members of staff, including social workers, lawyers, interpreters, project managers, communication officers and other supporting personne
